intro: Pseudojumellea filicornu, commonly known as the slender-spined jumellea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. The plant has slender, spiny stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
